page.title: 11HALTON HOLEGATE SCHOOL FETE
page.content: The annual School Fete is usually held on a Friday evening in June. It is held to raise money for school funds, and has proved to be a village event for everyone in the village, and not just for those involved in the school. There is a Fancy Dress Competition for the children, and a special attraction such as the Spilsby Town Band, the Halton Handbell Ringers, or Slide Shows. Stalls are run by the parents, and unwanted items are sent to school to sell, and these include toys, books, household items, bric-a-brac, plants, and home made cakes. Refreshments are served during the evening. There are games such as Bran Tub, Bean Bag, Darts, and throwing wet sponges at boys in the stocks. In 1985 the Fete raised a record total of Â£228.
